page.title: 08Milking, High Tremeneer Farm
page.content: The decision to give up milking at High Tremeneer farm was made in the year 1973. this was when the new bulk collecting for milk was brought into use. It was a large family decision to halt the milk process at Higher Tremeneer farm. My Dad believed that if he were to go into milk bulk collecting the financial part would be just too much. As we won the second farm at Georgia he felt that he would have to pay to have extra workers. The reason being that himself would be needed on the farm that we happen to live on for milking. This meant, losing all the profits through paying his workers each week. And after a large discussion with other family members the final decision was made. "Not enough profits would be made through milking and in the dairy trade generally". he said.
